metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42265 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an integer overflow may lead to information disclosure or data tampering.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnvidia-cfg1-515 - 515.86.01-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libnvidia-common-515 - 515.86.01-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libnvidia-compute-515 - 515.86.01-0ubuntu0.22.04.1

notes.Note: mdeslaur> some binary drivers are no longer support by NVidia, so they are marked as ignored here

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-418-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-430: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

nvidia-graphics-drivers-460: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-515 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '515.86.01-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-515-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '515.86.01-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
